caption: apps.facebook.com

data.message: And I don't think I'd have even noticed its existence, let alone gone to see it, were it not for Elke. (Thanks, Elke!)

description: A delicate, funny and often poignant documentary portrait of bicycle-riding octogenarian Bill Cunningham, the beloved New York Times style photographer who is world famous for his weekly "On the Street" column.
message:
Although not really my typical fare (as it does not include explosions, spaceships, aliens, or unexplored tombs), I very much enjoyed this fascinating documentary about Bill Cunningham. Every day, Cunningham photographs the fashion of the streets of New York for the NY Times (and has done so for many decades). Far from being egotistical or "fashionable" himself, like one often thinks of those in the fashion industry, Cunningham seems to take joy from fashion as personal expression.

It's really excellent: watch it.
name: Bill Cunningham New York

~orig.caption: apps.facebook.com
